title: NixOS Package PRs for findutils, util-linux-2.38.1, xdg, gcc-wrapper-12.2.0, yakuake, oxygen-sounds packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for findutils, util-linux-2.38.1, xdg, gcc-wrapper-12.2.0, yakuake, oxygen-sounds packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Per https://pypi.org/project/xdg/, the xdg package is deprecated. The replacement package, xdg-base-dirs, was added in #231868; it's almost a drop-in replacement, requiring only that import statements use the new name.

Closes #229815.

    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages

items.title: python3Packages.xdg: remove

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Prevent xdg-open from silently failing to call mimeopen and falling back to the browser whenever the mimetype doesn't have an explicitly set default application.

items.title: xdg-utils: allow xdg-open access to mimeopen

items.content_html:
xdg-utils does not cross-compile. Let's late-bind (using the runtime $PATH) in this scenario so a native-built xdg-utils can be used instead.

See also:

  • #225112
items.title: chromium: late-bind xdg-utils if broken

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Potential fix for #160923 although is not currently enabled by default.

MERGED Until #181171 gets merged, this relies on enabling an overlay for all those packages to actually use the xdg-open implementation from the path.

Many other packages rely on it implicitly without adding it in a wrapper so will work already without the overlay.

Some other things like the steam FHS env also require the overlay currently. Could get them to pick it up from the PATH in a subsequent PR?

items.title: nixos/xdg/xdg-open: init

items.content_html:
xdg-utils does not cross-compile. Let's late-bind (using the runtime $PATH) in this scenario so a native-built xdg-utils can be used instead.

See also:

  • #225112

With this PR and #225112 I am able to nix build pkgsCross.aarch64-multiplatform.firefox.

Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/pgqs3r3z83nzr9p5phi0ik0d23fzjcjc-python3.10-xdg-6.0.0 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A python310Packages.xdg https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/7cbc92d5eb28b9c33006a2874733a552d3c42d69.tar.gz

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/pgqs3r3z83nzr9p5phi0ik0d23fzjcjc-python3.10-xdg-6.0.0
ls -la /nix/store/pgqs3r3z83nzr9p5phi0ik0d23fzjcjc-python3.10-xdg-6.0.0/bin

items.title: python310Packages.xdg: 5.1.1 -> 6.0.0

items.content_html:
Ref: NixOS/nix#5588

This searches in $XDG_DATA_HOME/nix/profile everywhere where
previously we only looked in ~/.nix-profile, ditto for
.nix-channels and .nix-defexpr. This shouldn't break any
compatibility for now. It is highly recommended to use nixpkgs with
these changes if you want to use Nix with the XDG basedir PR, but not
doing so shouldn't result in any dramatic breakage -- in fact, NixOS
is perfectly usable without any user profile.

items.title: quakespasm: improve xdg desktop file, copy icons

items.content_html:
Description of changes

If $XDG_CACHE_HOME is not defined, we need to pass ~/.cache to lua-language-server as the cache directory. Currently, it will just create a directory called \$XDG_CACHE_HOME in the working directory.

the available portals would require logging out and in again.

items.title: nixos/portals: point $XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_DIR at the current system

items.content_html:
Description of changes

this backports multiple commits from flatpak and xdg-desktop portal:
d70098e/94cc90f
2dd58d6
db9b566

this fixes bugs in both, along with two cves for flatpak mentioned in #225487. i have also added myself as maintainer for the release-22.11 packages.
